Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The task involves processing an event log in DuckDB to find process variants and filter events to only those from the top K variants.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: The task focuses on analyzing an event log using DuckDB to identify process variants. The goal is to filter events to include only those from the top K process variants based on frequency or significance. The event log table, named event_log, contains key columns: case_id, activity, and timestamp.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Process variants are defined as the ordered sequence of activities for each case, sorted by timestamp. To identify variants, first aggregate activities per case using STRING_AGG, ordered by timestamp, in a CTE or subquery.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Group cases by their activity sequences to count occurrences and identify unique variants. Select the top K variants based on frequency, then filter events to include only cases belonging to these variants.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Create a CTE named variants to aggregate activities per case using STRING_AGG, ordered by timestamp, grouping by case_id. Use another CTE, top_variants, to count variant frequencies, order by frequency, and limit to top K variants, treating K as a parameter. Filter cases to include only those whose variants match the top K by joining or using IN with the top_variants CTE. Finally, select from the event_log where case_id belongs to the filtered cases, ensuring all events from relevant cases are included.
